FuncDef:
The optical-tx-power attenuation command configures an attenuation value for an optical module.
The undo optical-tx-power command restores the default attenuation value of an optical module.
By default, the attenuation value and optical power of an optical module is 0.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an attenuation value.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 200, in 0.1 dB.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To set an attenuation value of the output power on an optical interface, run the optical-tx-power command. A higher attenuation value will damage the optical module laser on the peer end, whereas a lower attenuation value will cause link connection failures.
Precautions
The CR5D00D2NT70 (2-Port 100GE Tunable DWDM Integrated Line Processing Unit (LPUI-200)) supports this command.
The following interface boards and subcards do not support this command:
